p.s: Many parents want to invest money for their children 's futures that will earn good interest .
Mutual funds often earn a higher interest rate than certificates of deposit ( CD ) or other savings accounts , although they carry a slightly higher risk .
Mutual funds are an investment option where money is pooled from different investors in order to purchase securities .
A fund manager makes decisions as to how the money is invested .
A diversified mutual fund can be a good place to put money for a child 's college fund or nest egg .
Learn how to buy mutual funds for children .

item.s: Decide the reason you are investing the money .
For many parents , they are saving for college , but for others , it may be for travel , medical expenses or living expenses .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 1.jpg

item.s: Calculate the amount of time you plan to invest the money before your child needs it .
If your child is very young and will not need the money for 20 years , you will want to choose different investments than if the child needs it in 5 years .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 2.jpg

item.s: You may be able to choose a target-date mutual fund .
These investment vehicles allow you to name the year you will need the money .
Only a few dozen investment firms offer this , so you will have to look specifically for this type of mutual fund .
Consider other types of investments for children , as well as mutual funds .
Mutual funds often have attractive dividends ; however , other investments may have tax advantages .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 3.jpg

item.s: If your child is college-bound , you may prefer a 529 college-savings plan .
The interest from these plans is not taxed by the IRS .
The options depend upon the state you live in , because some states allow you to choose a prepaid plan where you can buy tuition credits with today 's rates .
All states give a second option , the savings 529 plan .
These plans usually rely on mutual funds .
If your child is already working , they can start saving for retirement with a Roth IRA .
They can make contributions to the IRA depending upon the money they earn .
This money must be used for retirement if you want to get the tax benefits .
There are penalties for early withdrawal .
Set up a custodial account for your child .
Since a child cannot open an investment account on their own until they are 18 , you will need to open it with both your names on the account .
You may choose to do this at your own investment firm , in order to have ease of use and an investment broker you trust .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 4.jpg

item.s: Choose an investment company and broker with a long track record .
This money may be in the mutual fund for a long period of time , so you should be sure that the company has a long term plan with excellent management .
Spend plenty of time researching investment companies in your area , and you may see the benefit with your own investments as well .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 5.jpg

item.s: Look for mutual funds with low expenses .
Each investor in a mutual fund pays a fee to take part in the investment .
If these fees are large , they can add up over a long period of time , so compare using this metric as well as its past history .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 6.jpg

item.s: Choose a highly-diversified mutual fund .
Diversified mutual funds carry less risk , because they put money in many different types of securities .
If 1 type of security falls , another is likely to compensate .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 7.jpg

item.s: Choose mutual funds that do n't need to be watched constantly .
Diversified mutual funds are secure enough to allow a hands-off approach .
Talk with your broker about this aspect of different options .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 8.jpg

item.s: Decide how much capital you will start with .
Gift a lump sum to your child for use with this initial investment .
Unless you have decided upon a Roth IRA , you can use this initial amount to start the investment and add money to it in other lump sums in the future .

figure.rend: Buy Mutual Funds for Children Step 9.jpg

item.s: Teach children about their mutual fund when they are old enough to understand .
By around age 10 , children can start being put in charge of their own savings accounts , with supervision .
